newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Nikkei futures end firm but downtrend intact.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Nikkei futures end firm but downtrend intact.

text.p: SIMEX Nikkei futures ended firm on Monday after the Dow's unexpected recovery on Friday, but dealers said the market had not broken out of its downtrend.
"We're still in a sideways to down pattern. If December closes above 20,965, then we can relax because it should go higher," said a trader with a local futures house.
The benchmark Nikkei 225 December contract ended 380 points higher at 20,595. March finished at 20,640, up 390 points.
Dealers said rollover activity had picked up momentum and the market was likely to shift its focus to the March contract ahead of December's expiry on December 12.
The trader said the contract's close above the psychologically important 20,550 level was a positive sign, but it would face intra-day resistance around 20,760 on Tuesday.

Comments by U.S. Federal Reserve chairman Alan Greenspan that the Fed needed to be wary of "irrational exuberance" in U.S. stock and other asset markets sent world financial markets tumbling on Friday.
The Dow ended 55.16 points lower at 6,381.95 on Friday after dropping as much as 135 points during the session.
